title: Take your Vue projects to the next level with version 3 and the Apollo clients

description.description: Avocado Labs is a way to keep people connected online and have access to quality talks. There will be live talks, which will then be uploaded, where expert speakers can share their knowledge. These episodes will be hosted and moderated by our Auth0 developer advocates.

heroDescription.heroDescription: Avocado Labs is a way to keep people connected online and have access to quality talks. There will be live talks, which will then be uploaded, where expert speakers can share their knowledge. After each talk there will be a 5min Q&A where our speakers will be able to answer any related questions you may have. These episodes will be hosted and moderated by our Auth0 developer advocates to ensure a safe and friendly environment.

childMarkdownRemark.rawMarkdownBody: Avocado Labs is a way to keep people connected online and have access to quality talks. There will be live talks, which will then be uploaded, where expert speakers can share their knowledge. After each talk there will be a 5min Q&A where our speakers will be able to answer any related questions you may have. These episodes will be hosted and moderated by our Auth0 developer advocates to ensure a safe and friendly environment.

overviewSubsections.title: Take your Vue projects to the next level with version 3 and the Apollo clients

childMarkdownRemark.rawMarkdownBody:
What a wonderful Vue! In this episode we will see real life case studies on how to reach the next level with Vue. We will start with Natalia, a Vue core team member, showing us how we can use Apollo to access REST endpoints, batch queries and handle local state management! Then we will see how Filip, the co-founder of Vue Storefront, uses the Vue 3 composition API in @VueStorefront! 

A jam-packed session with lot's of Vue expert knowledge!

topicsSubsections.title: All you need is Apollo Client

description.description: While we usually mention Apollo Client only in the connection with GraphQL, it can do a lot more things to your Vue application: accessing REST endpoints, batching queries and handle local state management! In this talk I will cover these advanced cases with some best practices we've developed at GitLab

topicsSubsections.title: Composition API in action - how we use it in Vue Storefront?

description.description: Vue Storefront is currently the biggest Open Source eCommerce frontend that works with any backend platform and already has more than 100 live shops. For the past 2 years we are constantly improving our solution but we came to the point where architecture became a limitation... so we decided to do a rewrite and use the latest Vue features. As one of the first big projects in the world on Vue 3 we had a chance to explore and adapt new amazing patterns brought by Composition API. During this talk you will learn how using new Vue 3 features can bring developer experience to a completely new level!

intro.intro: Natalia Tepluhina is a Vue.js core team member and a Senior Frontend Engineer at GitLab.

Filip is a co-founder and lead architect of Vue Storefront - most popular eCommerce project on Vue.js, author of Storefront UI and community partner of Vue,js, During his daily job he focuses on frontend architecture, performance and API Design. In a free time he is sharing his knowledge on conferences, meetups and VueSchool blog.

description.description: All you need is Apollo Client
Composition API in action - how we use it in Vue Storefront?
